private final MyHandler mHandler = new MyHandler();
public static class MyRunnable implements Runnable {
    private final WeakReference<Activity> mActivity;
    public MyRunnable(Activity activity) {
        mActivity = new WeakReference<>(activity);
    }
    @Override
    public void run() throws Exception {
        Activity activity = mActivity.get();
        if (activity != null) {
            TextView textView = (TextView) activity.findViewById(R.id.textView_date_display);
            textView.setText(boxText);
        }
    }
}
private MyRunnable mRunnable = new MyRunnable(this);
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
    new Timer().schedule(new TimerTask() {
        // Rest of the code

<<<explanation>>>: The issue with the jumping digits in the last seconds place is due to the fact that the TextView is being updated on the UI thread every 100 milliseconds. To fix this, you can use a Handler and a Runnable to update the TextView on the UI thread at a slower rate. The code above demonstrates how to implement this solution.
